subject: Management
title: When to Accommodate
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: When to Accommodate.

hook.text: A senior designer let a junior's approach win. The idea was fine, and the junior needed confidence.

buildup.text: Accommodating means yielding your position to maintain the relationship or develop someone.

discovery.text: Use it when the issue matters more to them than to you, or when goodwill is the priority.

twist.text: Chronic accommodation makes you invisible. Strategic accommodation builds loyalty.

climax.text: Choose your battles. Yield on things that don't matter. Stand firm on things that do.

punchline.text: Giving ground is strength when you choose where to stand.

quiz.question: When should you use the accommodating conflict style?
options: When the issue matters more to the other person and goodwill is key
When you believe you're right but don't want to argue
When the stakes are high and both sides have equal claims
